PostToolUse.description: Validate epic closure prerequisites before marking epic as Done

hooks.prompt: If this update is marking an EPIC as Done (not a regular ticket), verify: 1) All sub-tickets are Done or Cancelled, 2) No workarounds or temporary solutions were shipped, 3) Business value was delivered. Epic closure requires all sub-tickets complete. If any sub-ticket is incomplete, BLOCK the epic closure and report which tickets need attention.

You MUST respond with valid JSON only. No markdown, no extra text.

Check for end-of-session issues:
1. Run `git diff --name-only` for modified files. For files in production code paths (src/, lib/, app/, services/, modules/, controllers/) that are code files (.ts, .js, .tsx, .jsx), check for TODO/FIXME comments, empty catch blocks, or console.log statements. Skip scripts/, tests/, __tests__/, *.test.*, *.spec.*, config files, documentation, and non-code changes.
2. If workflow commands (/adaptation, /implementation, /testing, /documentation, /codereview, /security-review) were used on a Linear ticket, note whether ticket status needs updating.

Respond with ONLY one of these JSON formats:
- If no issues found or no code changes: {"ok": true}
- If issues found: {"ok": true, "reason": "Session summary: <brief findings>"}

Do NOT block stopping. Always set ok to true. Use the reason field to surface findings.
